intro: Pluchea ferdinandi-muelleri, commonly known as the dwarf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. It is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
